titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joseph and Franklyn Kelly papers 1977.550
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:43:04 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection contains papers of Joseph Kelly and his son, Franklyn, spanning the period 1874 to 1899. Joseph Kelly's papers consist of bonds, mortgages, and deeds relating to property on Classon Avenue. Joseph's wife Ellen is also represented in some of the documents. Franklyn's papers consist of letters of administration and receipts pertaining to the death and estate of his aunt, Sarah W. Haggarty. Joseph Kelly married Ellen L. Haggarty and lived at 490 Classon Avenue in Brooklyn, N.Y. Their son, Franklyn, was appointed administrator for the estate of Ellen's sister, Sarah W. Haggarty.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Joseph Kelly married Ellen L. Haggarty and lived at 490 Classon Avenue in Brooklyn, N.Y. Their son, Franklyn, was appointed administrator for the estate of Ellen's sister, Sarah W. Haggarty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains papers of Joseph Kelly and his son, Franklyn, spanning the period 1874 to 1899. Joseph Kelly's papers consist of bonds, mortgages, and deeds relating to property on Classon Avenue. Joseph's wife Ellen is also represented in some of the documents. Franklyn's papers consist of letters of administration and receipts pertaining to the death and estate of his aunt, Sarah W. Haggarty.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Joseph and Franklyn Kelly papers, 1977.550, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
